user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of lfs_getattr:
```c
lfs_ssize_t lfs_getattr(lfs_t *lfs, const char *path,
        uint8_t type, void *buffer, lfs_size_t size) {
    int err = LFS_LOCK(lfs->cfg);
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }
    LFS_TRACE("lfs_getattr(%p, \"%s\", %"PRIu8", %p, %"PRIu32")",
            (void*)lfs, path, type, buffer, size);

    lfs_ssize_t res = lfs_getattr_(lfs, path, type, buffer, size);

    LFS_TRACE("lfs_getattr -> %"PRId32, res);
    LFS_UNLOCK(lfs->cfg);
    return res;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function lfs_getattr:
typedef int32_t  lfs_ssize_t
...
typedef uint32_t lfs_size_t
...
typedef struct lfs {
    lfs_cache_t rcache;
    lfs_cache_t pcache;

    lfs_block_t root[2];
    struct lfs_mlist {
        struct lfs_mlist *next;
        uint16_t id;
        uint8_t type;
        lfs_mdir_t m;
    } *mlist;
    uint32_t seed;

    lfs_gstate_t gstate;
    lfs_gstate_t gdisk;
    lfs_gstate_t gdelta;

    struct lfs_lookahead {
        lfs_block_t start;
        lfs_block_t size;
        lfs_block_t next;
        lfs_block_t ckpoint;
        uint8_t *buffer;
    } lookahead;

    const struct lfs_config *cfg;
    lfs_size_t block_count;
    lfs_size_t name_max;
    lfs_size_t file_max;
    lfs_size_t attr_max;
    lfs_size_t inline_max;

#ifdef LFS_MIGRATE
    struct lfs1 *lfs1;
#endif
} lfs_t
...
#define LFS_LOCK(cfg) ((void)cfg,0)
...
#define LFS_UNLOCK(cfg) ((void)cfg)
...
#define LFS_TRACE(__VA_ARGS__) 
...
static lfs_ssize_t lfs_getattr_(lfs_t *lfs, const char *path,
        uint8_t type, void *buffer, lfs_size_t size) {
    lfs_mdir_t cwd;
    lfs_stag_t tag = lfs_dir_find(lfs, &cwd, &path, NULL);
    if (tag < 0) {
        return tag;
    }

    uint16_t id = lfs_tag_id(tag);
    if (id == 0x3ff) {
        // special case for root
        id = 0;
        int err = lfs_dir_fetch(lfs, &cwd, lfs->root);
        if (err) {
            return err;
        }
    }

    tag = lfs_dir_get(lfs, &cwd, LFS_MKTAG(0x7ff, 0x3ff, 0),
            LFS_MKTAG(LFS_TYPE_USERATTR + type,
                id, lfs_min(size, lfs->attr_max)),
            buffer);
    if (tag < 0) {
        if (tag == LFS_ERR_NOENT) {
            return LFS_ERR_NOATTR;
        }

        return tag;
    }

    return lfs_tag_size(tag);
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
I found no uses of compiler-specific language extensions in the provided code. Specifically:
- No GCC/Clang attributes or builtins (e.g. __attribute__, __builtin_*, __asm__) are present.
- No statement-expressions ({ ... }) or typeof(), which are common compiler extensions, are used.
- No nested functions, zero-length arrays, or other nonstandard constructs appear.
- The integer types (int32_t, uint8_t, uint32_t, uint16_t) and format macros (PRIu8, PRIu32, PRId32) come from the standard <stdint.h>/<inttypes.h>, not compiler extensions.
- The variadic macro usage (LFS_TRACE(__VA_ARGS__)) and the comma operator/cast-to-void in the LFS_LOCK/LFS_UNLOCK macros are standard C (C99 and later) constructs, not compiler-specific extensions.
- Conditional compilation (#ifdef LFS_MIGRATE) and nested struct definitions are standard C.

Therefore there are no code fragments that should be reported for possible use of language extensions under MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2.
